instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> maybe a really dumb question, where is the board part number?
threads.message: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> maybe a really dumb question, where is the board part number? Ive got an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> in for water spill so its not turning on at all but ive looked all over the board and cant see a part number, its a early 2016 and there seams to be 3 different variations according to the serial number for this model/year , so im not sure what schematics to go and look for ?, ok a bit hasty it does come on and i can see a faint apple logo but dont have a test screen for one of these so board part number would be handy

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> maybe a really dumb question, where is the board part number?
threads.message: Early 2016 should be <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> maybe a really dumb question, where is the board part number?
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> maybe a really dumb question, where is the board part number?
threads.message: Under the sticker at the battery connector.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> maybe a really dumb question, where is the board part number?
threads.message: Thanks duke , saves me asking a stupid question again :-)
